content:
ning just “acting.”
The point is that under this new meaning of “selfish,” it becomes empty (or
almost empty) to say that all human actions are selfish. We are thus back to
a familiar situation. Under one interpretation (the ordinary interpretation),
the claim that all human actions are selfish is interesting but false. Under
another interpretation (an extraordinary interpretation), the claim is true
but vacuous. The position gets all its apparentinterest and plausibility from
a rapid two-step b
